text: Aspergillus conicus is a xerophilic species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus which can cause endophthalmitis in rare cases. It was first described in 1914.Dale, E. 1914. On the fungi of the soil. Part II. Fungi from chalky soil, uncultivated mountain peat, and the "black earth" of the reclaimed fenland. Annales Mycologici. 12(1):33-62 It is from the section Restricti. Aspergillus conicus has been reported as a human pathogen. ==Growth and morphology== A. conicus has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_conicus_cya.png|Aspergillus conicus growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_conicus_meaox.png|Aspergillus conicus growing on MEAOX plate ==References== ==Further reading== * conicus Category:Xerophiles Category:Fungi described in 1914
title: Aspergillus conicus
